page.title: 01INTRODUCTION-RESUME
page.content: This area, 6 kilometres to the North West of Leicester, contains the residential districts of{Anstey, {Glenfield and Groby.}These are small and busy villages with thriving community life,varied small industries and pleasantly sited near to the city and country. Between the villages is intensively managed grass and rough grazing land; the nature reserve at Groby Pool; the administrative centre for Leicestershire based at County Hall, Glenfield; the Glenfield Hospital complex and the start of several walks into the popular Charnwood district. Access to the area is easy from the motorway networks. The proposed Leicester Western Bypass will improve communications but will dissect the fast growing villages of Groby and Glenfield.
